Identification.LongTitle: Order Establishing Supplementary Rules Respecting the Sale of Natural Health Products Containing Ephedrine or Pseudoephedrine

Provision.Text: Whereas the Minister of Health believes on reasonable grounds that the use of a therapeutic product, other than the intended use, may present a risk of injury to health;

Therefore the Minister of Health makes the annexed Order Establishing Supplementary Rules Respecting the Sale of Natural Health Products Containing Ephedrine or Pseudoephedrine under section 30.01‍a of the Food and Drugs Actb.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this Order.

Definition.Text: combination product means a natural health product that contains, among its ingredients, ephedrine or any of its salts, pseudoephedrine or any of its salts, or any combination of those ingredients in combination with one or more other substances listed in Schedule 1 of the Regulations. (produit combiné)

non-combination product means a natural health product that contains, as its only medicinal ingredients, ephedrine or any of its salts, pseudoephedrine or any of its salts, or any combination of those ingredients. (produit non combiné )
pharmacist has the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations. (pharmacien)
Regulations means the Natural Health Products Regulations. (Règlement)

Subsection.Text: Unless the context requires otherwise, words and expressions used in this Order have the same meaning as in the Regulations.
Subject to subsection (2), this Order applies to the sale of combination products and non-combination products.
This Order does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale of combination products or non-combination products for the purposes of a clinical trial that is subject to Part 4 of the Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the distribution of combination products or non-combination products as samples under section 103.4 of the Regulations.

Section.Text: For greater certainty, unless otherwise provided for by this Order, the Regulations apply to combination products and non-combination products, except that the reference to “these Regulations” in paragraphs 18(1)(a) and 39(1)(a) and section 92 of the Regulations are to be read as including a reference to this Order.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (4), a person must not sell a combination product or non-combination product at the retail level.
A pharmacist or a person working under the supervision of a pharmacist may sell, at the retail level, a non-combination product that is not accessible to the public for self-selection.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — combination products offered for self-selection
Subsection.Text: A pharmacist or any other person working in a retail location serviced by a pharmacist may sell, at the retail level, a combination product that is accessible to the public for self-selection in the case where a pharmacist is available, at the request of a purchaser or consumer, to discuss the product prior to purchase.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — combination products not offered for self-selection
Subsection.Text: A pharmacist or a person working under the supervision of a pharmacist may sell a combination product at the retail level without making it accessible to the public for self-selection.

Section.Text: A person must not sell a combination product or non-combination product to another person, other than a pharmacist, for further sale at the retail level.
This Order comes into force on May 18, 2025, but if it is registered after that day, it comes into force on the day on which it is registered.
